item.name: TYPE A login requirements
item.description: **NOTE : api_key** and **access_token** are required to access any API's for TYPE A The **access_token** is valid for one day. Make sure to generate a new token after it expires to continue accessing the APIs. **Where can I find API_KEY?** Follow below steps to find **api_key** Step 1 - login to [https://trade.mstock.com](https://trade.mstock.com) enter your credentails Step 2 - Click on below highlighted menu bar Step 3 **\-** Click on Trading APIs Step 4 **\- COPY the api_Key** **Where can i find access_token?** To find your `access_token`, follow these steps: 1. **Start the Login Flow:** Begin by clicking on the Login API as instructed. **Login Step 1:** 1. Replace `XXXXXXXX` in the "Value" field with your actual username and password. 2. Submit the request. 3. An OTP will be sent to your registered mobile number. **Login Step 2 :** 1. **Hover on** **`api_key`****:** In the API interface, find the field labeled `api_key`. 2. **Enter your** **`api_key`****:** Input the `api_key` you obtained from Step 4. 3. **Enter OTP against** **`request_token`****:** - Locate the field for `request_token`. - Enter the OTP you received (from your registered mobile) in this field. 4. **Submit the Request:** This should complete the login process and provide you with the `access_token` in the API response. To find the Fund Summary using the API: 1. **Go to the Fund Summary API endpoint.** 2. **Hover on the** **`access_token`** **field.** 3. **Enter the** **`access_token`** you received in the response from the Generate Session API 4. **Submit the request** to retrieve your Fund Summary. ................................................................................................................................................................

request.description:
### API Endpoint: Login to Type A Connect

This endpoint is used to authenticate a user by logging into the Type A Connect service. It allows users to initiate a session and access secured resources.

#### Request Format

- **Method**: POST
    
- **URL**: `https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/connect/login`
    
- **Content-Type**: `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`
    

#### Request Body

The request body should be formatted as `x-www-form-urlencoded`. Currently, no specific parameters are required in the request body.

#### Response Format

The response from the server will typically include a status code indicating the success or failure of the login attempt, along with any relevant messages or data pertaining to the authentication process.

Ensure that the request is made with the appropriate headers and that any required authentication tokens are included if necessary.

item.description: ### Login flow **Step 1:** Generate API Key, Go to [trade.mstock.com](https://www.trade.mstock.com/) to generate the Api Key. Click [here](https://www.mstock.com/trading-api) if you have not yet generated. This Api-key has to be passed in all the API call as headers mentioned [here](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/Introduction/#request). Note mStock account is manadatory to genreate the API key. If you still do not have mstock account, [Open Account](https://www.mstock.com/open-demat-account). **Step 2:** Using the Api key, you can now login using the user name & password with connect/login api. This will generate the OTP. **Step 3:** You can use the OTP to generate the access Token, & use that with all the subsequent api calls. Warning Avoid api_key exposure. It's unsafe to embed it in mobile apps or client code! Never let access_token be public. ### User APIs | method | path | description | | --- | --- | --- | | POST | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/connect/login](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#login) | This endpoint allows users to log in to the application | | POST | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/session/token](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#generate-session) | This endpoint is used to retrieve a session token based on the provided API key, request token, and checksum. | | GET | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/user/fundsummary](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#fund-summary) | This endpoint used get the funds, cash and margin information for the user. | --- ### Login This endpoint allows users to log in to the application by providing their username and password. Successful authentication will send the OTP to users registered mobile no that can be used for subsequent requests. **Request Headers -** - **X-Mirae-Version :** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1. - **Content-Type :** For this request, it is set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded, which is used for submitting form data. [cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_1_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_1_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_1_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_1_4) ``` curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/connect/login' \ --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \ --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \ --data-urlencode 'username=XXXXX' \ --data-urlencode 'password=YYYYY' ``` **Request Body -** The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | username | string | The username of the user attempting to log in. (Example: XXXXX) | | password | string | The password associated with the username. (Example: XYZ@123) | **Response Structure -** The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome. - { "status": "success", "data": { "ugid": "xxxxxx-xxxxx-4b04-8086-a8b37f62953d", "is_kyc": "true", "is_activate": "true", "is_password_reset": "true", "is_error": "false", "cid": "XXXXX", "nm": "XXXXX", "flag": 0 }} - { "status": "error", "message": "Please provide valid api version.", "data": null} - { "status": "error", "message": "Invalid username or password (YYYY)", "data": null} --- ### Generate Session This endpoint is used to retrieve a session token based on the provided API key, request token, and checksum. The session token is essential for authenticating subsequent API requests **Request Headers -** - **X-Mirae-Version :** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1. - **Content-Type :** For this request, it is set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded, which is used for submitting form data. **cURL Command -** [cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_2_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_2_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_2_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_2_4) ``` curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/session/token' \ --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \ --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \ --data-urlencode 'api_key=xxx' \ --data-urlencode 'request_token=yyy' \ --data-urlencode 'checksum=L' ``` **Request Body -** The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | api_key | string | The API key provided to the user (Example: ay3KxxxxxxxxxxkB/MAKg@@). | | request_token | string | A token that uniquely identifies the session request (Example: 123). | | checksum | string | A validation string to ensure the integrity of the request (Example: L) | n.Tasc Fields mapping with mStock API Parameters â€“ | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | api_key | string | ay3KxxxxxxxxxxkB/MAKg@@ | | request_token | string | OTP (123); | | checksum | string | source (L) | **Response Structure -** The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome. - **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful request, the server returns a JSON object containing the session token and any relevant user details Note In below response access_token, enctoken and refresh_token are pasted half because its size is very large. ``` { "status": "success", "data": { "user_type": "individual", "email": "XXXX000@gmail.com", "user_name": "XXXXX", "user_shortname": "NA", "broker": "MIRAE", "exchanges": [ "NSE", "NFO", "CDS" ], "products": [ "CNC", "NRML", "MIS" ], "order_types": [ "MARKET", "LIMIT" ], "avatar_url": "", "user_id": "538", "api_key": "7328e5a975a5exxxxxxx", "access_token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9", "public_token": "4876d509-06c1-45db-8248-33dbde85135b", "enctoken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzUxMiJ9_juyp9To5lDGtr7jqmh-", "refresh_token": "iGcP5onq6MXJYHHvAE26qS1A2cLodotQqZE5azfsah8", "silo": "", "login_time": "2024-09-26 03:34:48", "meta": { "demat_consent": "physical" } } } ``` \- **Failure (HTTP Status 500):** If the request fails due to an invalid OTP passed, the server will return an error message. ``` { "status": "error", "message": "Entered OTP has been expired. Please regenerate a new one & enter the same.", "data": null } ``` \- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired. ``` { "status": "error", "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.", "error_type": "APIKeyException", "data": null } ``` --- ### Fund Summary This endpoint used get the funds, cash and margin information for the user. **Request Headers -** - **X-Mirae-Version :** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1. - **Authorization:** A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token **cURL Command -** [cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_3_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_3_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_3_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/User/#__tabbed_3_4) ``` curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/user/fundsummary' \ --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \ --header 'Authorization: token api_key:access_token' \ ``` **Request Body -** This endpoint does not require a request body or additional parameters in the query string for the retrieval of orders **Response Structure -** The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome. - **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful request, the server returns a JSON object containing the session token and any relevant user details Note In below response access_token, enctoken and refresh_token are pasted half because its size is very large. ``` { "status": "success", "data": [ { "ADDITIONAL_MARGIN": "0.0", "ADHOC_LIMIT": "99999999999", "AMOUNT_UTILIZED": "27395824.71", "AVAILABLE_BALANCE": "299972678840.29", "BANK_HOLDING": "99999999999", "CLEAR_BALANCE": "199999949998", "COLLATERALS": "74668", "LIMIT_SOD": "99999999999", "LIMIT_TYPE": "CAPITAL", "MF_COLLATERAL": "0.0", "MTF_AVAILABLE_BALANCE": "299972678840.29", "MTF_COLLATERAL": "0.0", "MTF_UTILIZE": "0.0", "MTM_COMBINED": "0", "OFS_UTILIZED": "0.0", "OPT_BUY_PRIMIUM_UTILIZE": "0.0", "PAY_OUT_AMT": "50000.0", "PEAK_MARGIN": "33222959.73", "PHYSICAL_MARGIN": "0.0", "REALISED_PROFITS": "0", "RECEIVABLES": "0", "SEG": "A", "SUM_OF_ALL": "300000024665", "UNCLEAR_BALANCE": "0" } ] } ``` \- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired. ``` { "status": "error", "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.", "error_type": "APIKeyException", "data": null } ``` EndFragment

header.description: Enter same API key used in request of generate session token. access_token received in response from generated session API should be used as access_token

item.name: Orders
item.description:
### Glossary

| param | value | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| variety | reg | Regular Order |
|  | amo | After Market Order |
|  | co | Cover Order |
| order_type | MARKET | Market Order |
|  | LIMIT | Limit Order |
|  | SL | Stoploss order |
|  | SL-M | Stoploss-market order |
| product | CNC | Cash & Carry for equity |
|  | NRML | Normal for futures and options |
|  | MIS | Margin Intraday Squareoff |
|  | MFT | mft |
| validity | DAY | Regular order |
|  | IOC | Immediate or Cancel |

---

### Order APIs

The order APIs let you place orders of different varities, modify and cancel pending orders, retrieve the daily order and more.

| method | path | description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| POST | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/orders/{variety}](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#order-placement) | Place a new order |
| PUT | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/orders/regular/{OrderID}](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#order-modification) | Modify a pending order |
| DELETE | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/orders/regular/{OrderID}](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#order-cancellation) | Cancel a pending order |
| POST | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/orders/cancelall](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#cancel-all) | Cancel all pending order |
| GET | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/orders](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#order-book) | View all the existing orders. |
| GET | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/trades](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#trade-history) | This endpoint returns a list of all trades generated upon the execution of orders for that day. |
| GET | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/order/details](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#individual-order-details) | View the status of individual order |

---

### Order Placement

This endpoint allows users to place a regular trading order in the specified market. Users must provide relevant order details such as the trading symbol, exchange, transaction type, and other order specifics.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:** A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token
    
- **Content-Type:** For this request, it is set to [application/x-www-form-urlencoded](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#), which is used for submiting form data.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_1_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_1_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_1_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_1_4)

```
curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/orders/{variety}' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header 'Authorization: token api_key:access_token \
    --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    --data-urlencode 'tradingsymbol=INFY' \
    --data-urlencode 'exchange=NSE' \
    --data-urlencode 'transaction_type=BUY' \
    --data-urlencode 'order_type=LIMIT' \
    --data-urlencode 'quantity=10' \
    --data-urlencode 'product=MIS' \
    --data-urlencode 'validity=DAY' \
    --data-urlencode 'price=1250'

 ```

**Request Body -** The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| variety | string | Variety of the order ( `regular` `amo` `co`) |
| tradingsymbol | string | Refer Trading Symbol in Tables |
| transaction_type | string | The trading side of transaction : `BUY` `SELL` |
| order_type | string | Order Type :`MARKET` `LIMIT` `SL` `SL-M` |
| quantity | string | Number of shares for the order |
| product | string | Product type `CNC` `NRML` `MIS` `MTF` |
| validity | string | Validity of Order `DAY` `IOC` |
| price | string | Price at which order is placed |

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful order placement, the server returns a JSON object containing the order ID and status
    

```
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": {
        "order_id": "1131241001100"
    }
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 401):** If the order fails due to invalid parameters, authentication issues, or other errors, the server will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Invalid request. Please try again.",
    "error_type": "TokenException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 200):** If market is closed or not connected to NSE then api will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "System is not connected to NSE Equity market",
    "error_type": "InputException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "error_type": "APIKeyException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Order Modification

This endpoint allows users to update/modify an existing order by specifying the order ID and providing the updated order details.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:** A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token.
    
- **Content-Type:** Indicated the media type of the resource. For this request, it is set to [application/x-www-form-urlencoded](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#), which is used for submiting form data.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_2_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_2_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_2_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_2_4)

```
curl --location --request PUT 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/orders/regular/1000000000016050' \
--header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
--header 'Authorization: token api_key:access_token' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
--data-urlencode 'order_type=LIMIT' \  
--data-urlencode 'quantity=5' \
--data-urlencode 'price=2000' \
--data-urlencode 'validity=DAY' \
--data-urlencode 'disclosed_quantity=0' \
--data-urlencode 'trigger_price=0'

 ```

**Path Parameter -**

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| order_id | The unique identifier of the order to be updated or modified |

**Request Body -** The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| variety | string | Variety of the order ( `regular` `amo` `co`) |
| tradingsymbol | string | Refer Trading Symbol in Tables |
| order_type | string | Order Type :`LIMIT` `MARKET` `SL` `SL-M` |
| quantity | string | Number of shares for the order |
| price | string | Price at which order is placed |
| validity | string | Validity of Order `DAY` `IOC` |
| exchange | string | Validity of Order `NSE` `BSE` |
| trigger_price | string | Price at which the order is triggered, in case of `SL` `SL-M` |
| disclosed_quantity | string | Number of shares visible (Keep more than 30% of quantity) |
| transaction_type | string | The trading side of transaction : `BUY` `SELL` |
| product | string | Product type `CNC` `MIS` `MTF` `NRML` |
| modqty_remng | string | Remaining quantity |

**Request Response -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful order update, the server returns a JSON object containing the order ID and status.
    

```
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": {
        "order_id": "1131241001100"
    }
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 401):** If the order fails due to invalid parameters, authentication issues, or other errors, the server will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Invalid request. Please try again.",
    "error_type": "TokenException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 200):** If orderid does not exist then server will return below json reponse.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Order Does not Exsist.Need to refresh orderbook / relogin in application ",
    "error_type": "InputException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

\- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired.

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "error_type": "APIKeyException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Order Cancellation

This endpoint allows users to delete an existing order specified by the order ID. Deleting an order will cancel the specified order.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:** A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_3_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_3_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_3_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_3_4)

```
curl --location --request DELETE 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/orders/regular/1161241001100' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header 'Authorization: token api_key:access_token'

 ```

**Path Parameter -**

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| order_id | The unique identifier of the order to be cancel. |

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful order deletion, the server returns a JSON object containing the order ID and status.
    

```
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": {
        "order_id": "1161241001100"
    }
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 200):** If orderid does not exist then server will return below json reponse.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Order Does not Exsist.Need to refresh orderbook / relogin in application ",
    "error_type": "InputException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "error_type": "APIKeyException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Cancel All

This endpoint allows users to cancel all the orders at once.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:** A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_4_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_4_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_4_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_4_4)

```
curl --location --request POST 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/orders/cancelall' \
--header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
--header 'Authorization: token api_key:access_token' \

 ```

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful order deletion, the server returns a JSON object containing the order ID and status.
    

```
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": {
        "order_id": "1161241001100"
    }
}

 ```

\- **Failure (HTTP Status 200):** If orderid does not exist then server will return below json reponse.

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Order Does not Exsist.Need to refresh orderbook / relogin in application ",
    "error_type": "InputException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "error_type": "APIKeyException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Order Book

This endpoint allows users to retrieve a list of their trading orders. Users can view all their existing orders.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:** A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_5_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_5_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_5_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_5_4)

```
curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/orders' \

---

### Trade History

While an orders is sent as single entry but, it may get executed in arbitrary chunks at the exchange level. This endpoint returns a list of all trades generated upon the execution of orders for that day.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:** A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token.
    
- **Content-Type:** Indicated the media type of the resource. For this request, it is set to [application/x-www-form-urlencoded](https://mapi.mirae-asset.co.in/developer/type-a/application/x-www-form-urlencoded), which is used for submiting form data.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_6_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_6_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_6_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Orders/#__tabbed_6_4)

```
curl --location --request GET 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/trades' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header 'Authorization: token api_key:access_token' \
    --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    --data-urlencode 'fromdate=2024-01-06' \
    --data-urlencode 'todate=2025-01-07'

 ```

| Field | Type | Description |

| fromdate | string | 2024-01-06 |
| todate | string | 2025-01-07 |

---

### Individual Order Details

This endpoint allows users to retrieve the status of individual order using the order id.

**Request Headers -**

### Net Position

### Position Converstion

Each position has one margin product. These products affect how the user's margin usage and free cash values are computed, and a user may wish to convert or change a position's margin product on timely basis.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version :**Â Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization :**Â A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Position/#__tabbed_2_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Position/#__tabbed_2_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Position/#__tabbed_2_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Position/#__tabbed_2_4)

```
curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/portfolio/convertposition' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header 'Authorization: token api_key:access_token'\
    --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    --data-urlencode 'tradingsymbol=ACC' \
    --data-urlencode 'exchange=NSE' \
    --data-urlencode 'transaction_type=BUY' \
    --data-urlencode 'position_type=DAY' \
    --data-urlencode 'quantity=1' \
    --data-urlencode 'old_product=CNC' \
    --data-urlencode 'new_product=MIS'

 ```

**Request Body -**

This endpoint does not require a request body or additional parameters in the query string for the retrieval of orders.

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| tradingsymbol | string | Refer Trading Symbol in Tables |
| exchange | string | Exchange Name :Â `NSE`Â `BSE` |
| transaction_type | string | The trading side of transaction :Â `BUY`Â `SELL` |
| position_type | string | Position Type :Â `DAY` |

item.name: Basket Orders
item.description:
### Basket APIs

The Basket Order APIs let you create, fetch, update and delete existing baskets.

| method | path | description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| POST | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/CreateBasket](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#create-basket) | Create new basket |
| PUT | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/FetchBasket](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#fetch-basket) | Fetch all basket |
| DELETE | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/RenameBasket](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#rename-basket) | Rename existing basket |
| POST | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/DeleteBasket](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#delete-basket) | Delete existing basket |
| GET | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/CalculateBasket](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#calculate-basket) | Calculate Basket |

---

### Create Basket

This endpoint allows users to create new basket. Users must provide relevant basket details such as basket name and description of basket.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:**Â Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:**Â A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token
    
- **Content-Type:**Â For this request, it is set toÂ [application/x-www-form-urlencoded](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#), which is used for submiting form data.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_1_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_1_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_1_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_1_4)

```
curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/CreateBasket' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header ''Authorization: token api_key:access_token \
    --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    --data-urlencode 'BaskName=BasketTest-1' \
    --data-urlencode 'BaskDesc=Basket Description'

 ```

**Request Body -**Â The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| BaskName | string | Name of the basket |
| BaskDesc | string | Descrition of the basket |

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):**Â On successful basket creation, the server returns a JSON object as shown below
    

```
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": "Basket Created Successfully"
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 401):**Â If the order fails due to invalid parameters, authentication issues, or other errors, the server will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Invalid request. Please try again.",
    "error_type": "TokenException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 200):**Â If basket is already exists then api will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Basket Already Added For This Name",
    "error_type": "MiraeException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):**Â If the API Key is Invalid or expired.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "error_type": "APIKeyException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Fetch Basket

This endpoint allows users to create new basket. Users must provide relevant basket details such as basket name and description of basket.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:**Â Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:**Â A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token
    
- **Content-Type:**Â For this request, it is set toÂ [application/x-www-form-urlencoded](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#), which is used for submiting form data.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_2_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_2_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_2_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_2_4)

```
curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/FetchBasket' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header 'Authorization: token api_key:access_token'

 ```

**Request Body -**Â This endpoint does not require a request body or additional parameters in the query string for the retrieval of orders.

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):**Â On successful basket fetch, the server returns a JSON object as shown below
    

```
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": [
        {
            "BASKET_ID": 215,
            "BASKET_NAME": "ABC Update",
            "COUNT": 4,
            "CREATE_DATE": "2024-11-19T05:40:07Z",
            "DESCRIPTOR": ""
        },
        {
            "BASKET_ID": 209,
            "BASKET_NAME": "BANKEX",
            "COUNT": 1,
            "CREATE_DATE": "2024-11-13T06:42:37Z",
            "DESCRIPTOR": ""
        }
    ]
}

- **Failure (HTTP Status 401):**Â If the order fails due to invalid parameters, authentication issues, or other errors, the server will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Invalid request. Please try again.",
    "error_type": "TokenException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

\-Â **Failure (HTTP Status 400):**Â If the API Key is Invalid or expired.

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "error_type": "APIKeyException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Rename Basket

This endpoint allows users to rename an existing baslet by specifying the new basket name and existing basket ID.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:**Â Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:**Â A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token.
    
- **Content-Type:**Â Indicated the media type of the resource. For this request, it is set toÂ [application/x-www-form-urlencoded](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#), which is used for submiting form data.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_3_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_3_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_3_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_3_4)

```
curl --location --request PUT 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/RenameBasket' \
--header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
--header 'Authorization: token api_key:access_token' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
--data-urlencode 'basketName=New Basket Name Updated' \
--data-urlencode 'BasketId=255'

 ```

**Request Body -**Â The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| basketName | string | New name for the basket |
| BasketId | string | The unique identifier of the basket to be renamed |

**Request Response -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):**Â On successful rename of basket, the server returns a JSON object containing the status.
    

```
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 401):**Â If the order fails due to invalid parameters, authentication issues, or other errors, the server will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Invalid request. Please try again.",
    "error_type": "TokenException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 200):**Â If basket name is already exists then server will return below json reponse.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Invalid request. Please check and try again.",
    "error_type": "MiraeException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

\-Â **Failure (HTTP Status 400):**Â If the API Key is Invalid or expired.

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "error_type": "APIKeyException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Delete Basket

This endpoint allows users to delete an existing basket by specifying the basket ID.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:**Â Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:**Â A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token.
    
- **Content-Type:**Â Indicated the media type of the resource. For this request, it is set toÂ [application/x-www-form-urlencoded](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#), which is used for submiting form data.
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_4_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_4_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_4_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_4_4)

```
curl --location --request DELETE 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/DeleteBasket' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header 'Authorization: token api_key:access_token'
    --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    --data-urlencode 'BasketId=255'

 ```

**Path Parameter -**

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| BasketId | The unique identifier of the basket to be deleted. |

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):**Â On successful order deletion, the server returns a JSON object containing the order ID and status.
    

```
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": "Basket Deleted Successfully"
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 401):**Â If the order fails due to invalid parameters, authentication issues, or other errors, the server will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Invalid request. Please try again.",
    "error_type": "TokenException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):**Â If the API Key is Invalid or expired.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "error_type": "APIKeyException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Calculate Basket

This endpoint allows users to calculate the basket. Users must provide relevant such as basket id, product, segment, script code, basekt name, etc.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:**Â Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_5_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_5_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_5_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeA/Basket/#__tabbed_5_4)

curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typea/CalculateBasket' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header ''Authorization: token api_key:access_token \
    --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    --data-urlencode 'include_exist_pos=0' \
    --data-urlencode 'ord_product=C' \
    --data-urlencode 'disc_qty=0' \

**Request Body -**Â The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters:

| Field | Type | Description |

| ord_product | string | Product type (C) |

| script_stat | string | Script Stat (A) |
| buy_sell_indi | string | Transaction Type (B-BUY and S-SELL) |
| basket_priority | string | Basket Priority (1) |
| order_price | string | Order Price |
| basket_id | string | Basket ID |
| exch_id | string | Exchange (NSE and BSE) |

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):**Â On successful API call, the server returns a JSON object as shown below
    

```
{
    "status": "success",

                "PRODUCT": "C",

                "REQ_SPAN": 0,
                "SCRIPT_CODE": "11915",
                "SCRIPT_STATUS": "A",

            }
        ]
    }
}

- **Failure (HTTP Status 401):**Â If the API request fails due to invalid parameters, authentication issues, or other errors, the server will return an error message with below json format.
    

```

The historical data API provides the historical data for instruments across various exchange segment.

Historical Data Limit

---

### Top Gainer/Losers API

This endpoint allows users to retrieve list of top gainers and losers.

**Request Headers -**

item.name: TYPE B Login requirements
item.description: NOTE **: api_key** and **jwt_token** are required to access any API's for TYPE B TheÂ **jwt_token**Â is valid for one day. Make sure to generate a new token after it expires to continue accessing the APIs. **Where can I find API_KEY?** Follow below steps to find **api_key** 1. **Login:** Go to [https://trade.mstock.com](https://null) and enter your credentials. 2. **Open the Menu:** Click on the highlighted menu bar after logging in. 3\. **Navigate to Trading APIs:** Select the "Trading APIs" option from the menu. 4\. **Copy the** **`api_key`****:** Your `api_key` will be displayed. Copy it for use in your API requests. **Where can I find jwt_token?** To find jwt_token we require refresh token **Where can I get refresh_token?** Follow below steps to find refresh_token 1. **Click on** `Login API`. 2. **Replace** `XXXXXXXX` with your actual **username** and **password** in the request body. 3. **Click** `Send` to submit the request. 4. In the response: - You will receive a `refresh_token`. - An **OTP** (One-Time Password) will be sent to your **registered mobile number**. > <p >âš ï¸ Ensure your credentials are correct and your mobile number is up to date to receive the OTP.</p> 1. **Locate the generate session API request.** 2. **Replace** **`XXXXXXXX`** with the `refresh_token` you received earlier. 3. **Enter the OTP** in the required field. 4. **Submit the request** to generate a new session. To access any API: 1. **Enter** **`api_key`****:** Input your `api_key` as required. 2. **Hover on** **`jwt_token`****:** Find the `jwt_token` field in the API request. 3. **Enter** **`jwt_token`****:** Paste the `jwt_token` you received from the Generate Session API. 4. **Proceed:** Submit the request to access the Holdings API. ................................................................................................................................................................

item.name: User
item.description: ### Login flow **Step 1:** Generate API Key, Go to [trade.mstock.com](https://www.trade.mstock.com/) to generate the Api Key. Click [here](https://www.mstock.com/trading-api) if you have not yet generated. This Api-key has to be passed in all the API call as headers mentioned [here](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/Introduction/#request). Note mStock account is manadatory to genreate the API key. If you still do not have mstock account, [Open Account](https://www.mstock.com/open-demat-account). **Step 2:** Using the Api key, you can now login using the user name & password with [connect/login](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#login) api. This will generate the OTP. **Step 3:** You can use the OTP to generate the access Token, & use that with all the subsequent api calls. Warning Avoid api_key exposure. It's unsafe to embed it in mobile apps or client code! Never let access_token be public. --- ### User APIs | method | path | description | | --- | --- | --- | | POST | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/connect/login](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#login) | This endpoint allows users to log in to the application | | POST | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/session/token](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#generate-session) | This endpoint is used to retrieve a session token based on the provided API key, request token, and checksum. | | GET | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/user/fundsummary](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#fund-summary) | This endpoint used get the funds, cash and margin information for the user. | --- ### Login This endpoint allows users to log in to the application by providing their username and password. Successful authentication will send the OTP to users registered mobile no that can be used for subsequent requests. **Request Headers -** - **X-Mirae-Version:** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1. - **Content-Type:** For this request, it is set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded, which is used for submiting form data through body. [cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_1_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_1_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_1_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_1_4) ``` curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/connect/login' \ --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \ --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-raw '{ "clientcode": "XXXXX", "password": "YYYYY", "totp": "", "state": "" }' ``` **Request Body -** The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | clientcode | string | The username of the user attempting to log in. (Example: XXXXX) | | password | string | The password associated with the username. (Example: XYZ@123) | | totp | string | Empty string | | state | string | Empty string | **Response Structure -** The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome. - **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful login, the server returns a JSON object containing the authentication token and any relevant user information. ``` { "status": "true", "message": "Please enter the OTP that we sent on XXXXXXX452 and XXXX00@GMAIL.COM", "errorcode": "", "data": { "jwtToken": "697c39bf-9411-46b0-81c2-67448ee99c72", "refreshToken": "", "feedToken": "", "state": "live" } } ``` \- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the version is incorrect, the server will return an error message. ``` { "status": "false", "message": "Please provide valid clientcode and password.", "errorcode": "400", "data": null } ``` - **Failure (HTTP Status 500):** If the login credentials are incorrect, the server will return an error message. ``` { "status": "false", "message": "Invalid username or password. 9 attempts remaining ", "errorcode": "500", "data": null } ``` --- ### Generate Session This endpoint is used to retrieve a session token based on the provided refreshToken and otp. The session token is essential for authenticating subsequent API requests. **Request Headers -** - **X-Mirae-Version :** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1. - **Content-Type :** For this request, it is set to application/json, which is used for submiting form through data. - **X-PrivateKey :** private_key [cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_2_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_2_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_2_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_2_4) ``` curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/session/token' \ --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \ --header 'X-PrivateKey: private_key' \ --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data '{ "refreshToken": "refreshToken", "otp":"123" }' ``` **Request Body -** The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | refreshToken | string | refreshToken | | otp | string | A token that uniquely identifies the session request (Example: 123). | n.Tasc Fields mapping with mStock API Parameters â€“ | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | refreshToken | string | refreshToken | | request_token | string | OTP (123); | **Response Structure -** The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome. - **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful login, the server returns a JSON object containing the authentication token and any relevant user details. Note In below response access_token, enctoken and refresh_token are pasted half because its size is very large. ``` { "status": "true", "message": "Please enter the OTP that we sent on XXXXXXX928 and XXXXEY@XXXXXCM.COM", "errorcode": "", "data": { "jwtToken": "{{vault:json-web-token}}", "refreshToken": "{{vault:json-web-token}}", "feedToken": "{{vault:json-web-token}}", "state": "live" } } ``` - **Failure (HTTP Status 500):** If the request fails due to an invalid OTP passed, the server will return an error message. ``` { "status": "false", "message": "Entered OTP has been expired. Please regenerate a new one & enter the same.", "errorcode": "500", "data": null } ``` - **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired. ``` { "status": "error", "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.", "data": null } ``` --- ### Fund Summary This endpoint used get the funds, cash and margin information for the user. **Request Headers -** - **X-Mirae-Version :** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1. - **Authorization :** A token-based authentication header. The format is token api_key:access_token. - **X-PrivateKey :** private_key [cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_3_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_3_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_3_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/User/#__tabbed_3_4) ``` curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/user/fundsummary' \ --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \ --header 'Authorization: {{vault:bearer-token}}' \ --header 'X-PrivateKey: private_key' ``` **Request Body -** This endpoint does not require a request body or additional parameters in the query string for the retrieval of orders **Response Structure-** The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome. - **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful request, the server returns a JSON object containing the session token and any relevant user details Note In below response access_token, enctoken and refresh_token are pasted half because its size is very large. ``` { "status": true, "message": "SUCCESS", "errorcode": "", "data": [ { "ADDITIONAL_MARGIN": "0.0", "ADHOC_LIMIT": "99999999999", "AMOUNT_UTILIZED": "27395824.71", "AVAILABLE_BALANCE": "299972678840.29", "BANK_HOLDING": "99999999999", "CLEAR_BALANCE": "199999949998", "COLLATERALS": "74668", "LIMIT_SOD": "99999999999", "LIMIT_TYPE": "CAPITAL", "MF_COLLATERAL": "0.0", "MTF_AVAILABLE_BALANCE": "299972678840.29", "MTF_COLLATERAL": "0.0", "MTF_UTILIZE": "0.0", "MTM_COMBINED": "0", "OFS_UTILIZED": "0.0", "OPT_BUY_PRIMIUM_UTILIZE": "0.0", "PAY_OUT_AMT": "50000.0", "PEAK_MARGIN": "33222959.73", "PHYSICAL_MARGIN": "0.0", "REALISED_PROFITS": "0", "RECEIVABLES": "0", "SEG": "A", "SUM_OF_ALL": "300000024665", "UNCLEAR_BALANCE": "0" } ] } ``` - **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired. ``` { "status": "error", "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.", "data": null } ```

item.description:
### Glossary

| param | value | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Variety | NORMAL | Normal Order (Regular) |
|  | AMO | After Market Order |
|  | ROBO | ROBO (Bracket Order) |
|  | STOPLOSS | Stop Loss Order |
| Order Type | MARKET | Market Order |
|  | LIMIT | Limit Order |
|  | STOP_LOSS | Stop Loss Order |
|  | STOP_LOSS_MARKET | Stop Loss Market Order |
| Product Type | DELIVERY | Cash & Carry for equity |
|  | INTRADAY | Margin Intraday Squareoff |
|  | MARGIN | Margin Delivery |
|  | CARRYFORWARD | Normal for futures and options |
| Duration | DAY | Regular order |
|  | IOC | Immediate or Cancel |

---

### Orders APIs

The order APIs let you place orders of different varities, modify and cancel pending orders, retrieve the daily order and more.

| method | path | description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| GET | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/orders/regular](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#order-placement) | Place a new order |
| PUT | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/orders/regular/{OrderID}](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#order-modification) | Modify a pending order |
| DELETE | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/orders/regular/{OrderID}](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#order-cancellation) | Cancel a pending order |
| POST | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/orders/cancelall](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#cancel-all) | Cancel all pending order |
| GET | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/orders](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#order-book) | View all the existing orders. |
| GET | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/trades](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#trade-history) | This endpoint returns a list of all trades generated upon the execution of orders for that day. |
| GET | [https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/order/details](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#individual-order-details) | View the status of individual order |

---

### Order Placement

This endpoint allows users to place a regular trading order in the specified market. Users must provide relevant order details such as the trading symbol, exchange, transaction type, and other order specifics.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version :** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization :** A token-based authentication header. The format is token jwtToken.
    
- **Content-Type :** A token-based authentication header. The format is token jwtToken. Content-Type: For this request, it is set to application/json, which is used for submiting form data through body.
    
- **X-PrivateKey :** api_key
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_1_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_1_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_1_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_1_4)

```
curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/orders/regular' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header 'X-PrivateKey: api_key' \
    --header 'Authorization: {{vault:bearer-token}}' \
    --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    --data '{
    "variety": "NORMAL",
    "tradingsymbol": "ACC-EQ",
    "symboltoken": "22",
    "exchange": "NSE",
    "transactiontype": "BUY",
    "ordertype": "MARKET",
    "quantity": "20",
    "producttype": "DELIVERY",
    "price": "194.50",
    "triggerprice": "0",
    "squareoff": "0",
    "stoploss": "0",
    "trailingStopLoss": "",
    "disclosedquantity": "",
    "duration": "DAY",
    "ordertag": ""
    }'

 ```

**Request Body -** The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| variety | string | Variety of the order ( `NORMAL` `AMO` `ROBO` `STOPLOSS` ) |
| tradingsymbol | string | Refer Trading Symbol in Tables |
| symboltoken | string | Token of the contract for which modify is being sent |
| exchange | string | Exchange name : `NSE` `BSE` |
| transaction_type | string | The trading side of transaction : `BUY` `SELL` |
| order_type | string | Order Type :`LIMIT` `MARKET` `STOP_LOSS` `STOP_LOSS_MARKET` |
| quantity | string | Number of shares for the order |
| producttype | string | Product Type `DELIVERY` `INTRADAY` `MARGIN` `CARRYFORWARD` |
| price | string | Price at which order is placed |
| trigger_price | string | Price at which the order is triggered, in case of `STOP_LOSS` `STOP_LOSS_MARKET` |
| squareoff | string | Auto Sqaure off |
| stoploss | string | Stop Loss order |
| trailingStopLoss | string | Trailing Stop Loss order |
| disclosedquantity | string | Number of shares visible (Keep more than 30% of quantity) |
| duration | string | Regular Order Immediate or Cancel |
| ordertag | string | It is optional to apply to an order to identify. The length of the tag should be less than 20 (alphanumeric) characters. |

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- { "status": "true", "message": "SUCCESS", "errorcode": "", "data": { "script": "ACC-EQ", "orderid": "1191241106101", "uniqueorderid": "" }}
    
- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the order fails due to invalid parameters, authentication issues, or other errors, the server will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "false",
    "message": "Invalid request. Please try again.",
    "errorcode": "IA401",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 200):** If market is closed or not connected to NSE then api will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "false",
    "message": "RMS:1141241105101:NSE,EQUITY,22,ACC,INTRADAY,,EQ,XXXXX,B,1,I,22,ACC,INTRADAY,89.44995,FUND LIMIT INSUFFICIENT,AVAILABLE FUND=0,ADDITIONAL REQUIRED FUND=572.36,CALCULATED MARGIN FOR ORDER=572.36",
    "errorcode": "RS-0111",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired.
    

```
{
    "status": "false",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "errorcode": "IA403",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Order Modification

This endpoint allows users to update/modify an existing order by specifying the order ID and providing the updated order details.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version :** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization :** A token-based authentication header. The format is token jwtToken.
    
- **Content-Type :** Indicated the media type of the resource. For this request, it is set to application/json, which is used for submiting form data through body
    
- **X-PrivateKey :** api_key
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_2_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_2_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_2_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_2_4)

```
curl --location --request PUT 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/orders/regular/1191241106101' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header 'X-PrivateKey: api_key' \
    --header 'Authorization: {{vault:bearer-token}}' \
    --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    --data '{
    "variety": "NORMAL",
    "tradingsymbol": "ACC-EQ",
    "symboltoken": "22",
    "exchange": "NSE",
    "transactiontype": "BUY",
    "orderid": "1191241106101",
    "ordertype": "MARKET",
    "quantity": "15",
    "producttype": "DELIVERY",
    "duration": "DAY",
    "price": "2240",
    "triggerprice": "0",
    "disclosedquantity": "",
    "modqty_remng": "0"
    }'

 ```

**Path Parameter -**

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| order_id | The unique identifier of the order to be updated or modified |

**Request Body -** The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| variety | string | Variety of the order ( `NORMAL` `AMO` `ROBO` `STOPLOSS` ) |
| tradingsymbol | string | Refer Trading Symbol in Tables |
| symboltoken | string | Token of the contract for which modify is being sent |
| exchange | string | Exchange name : `NSE` `BSE` |
| transaction_type | string | The trading side of transaction : `BUY` `SELL` |
| orderid | string | Order Id Number |
| order_type | string | Product Type `DELIVERY` `INTRADAY` `MARGIN` `CARRYFORWARD` |
| quantity | string | Number of shares for the order |
| producttype | string | Product Type `CNC` `INTRADAY` `MARGIN` `MTF` `CO` `BO` |
| duration | string | Regular Order Immediate or Cancel |
| price | string | Price at which order is placed |
| trigger_price | string | Price at which the order is triggered, in case of `STOP_LOSS` `STOP_LOSS_MARKET` |
| squareoff | string | Auto Sqaure off |
| disclosedquantity | string | Number of shares visible (Keep more than 30% of quantity) |
| modqty_remng | string | Remaining quantity |

**Request Response -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful order update, the server returns a JSON object containing the order ID and status.
    

```
{
    "status": "true",
    "message": "SUCCESS",
    "errorcode": "",
    "data": {
        "orderid": " 1191241106101",
        "uniqueorderid": ""
    }
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 401):** If the order fails due to invalid parameters, authentication issues, or other errors, the server will return an error message with below json format.
    

```
{
    "status": "false",
    "message": "Enter valid trigger price.",
    "errorcode": "400",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 200):** If orderid does not exist then server will return below json reponse.
    

```
{
    "status": "false",
    "message": "Order is Cancelled.Kindly refresh your OrderBook",
    "errorcode": "RS-0034",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired.
    

```
{
    "status": "false",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "errorcode": "IA403",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Order Cancellation

This endpoint allows users to delete an existing order specified by the order ID. Deleting an order will cancel the specified order.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version :** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization :** A token-based authentication header. The format is token jwtToken.
    
- **Content-Type :** Indicated the media type of the resource. For this request, it is set to application/json, which is used for submiting form data through body
    
- **X-PrivateKey :** api_key
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_3_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_3_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_3_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_3_4)

```
curl --location --request DELETE 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/orders/regular/1112241106105' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header 'X-PrivateKey: api_key' \
    --header 'Authorization: {{vault:bearer-token}} \
    --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    --data '{
    "variety": "NORMAL",
    "orderid": "1181250130106"
    }'

 ```

**Path Parameter -**

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| order_id | The unique identifier of the order to be updated or modified |

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful order deletion, the server returns a JSON object containing the order ID and status.
    

```
{
    "status": "true",
    "message": "SUCCESS",
    "errorcode": "",
    "data": {
        "orderid": "201020000000080",
        "uniqueorderid": ""
    }
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 200):** If orderid does not exist then server will return below json reponse.
    

```
{
    "status": "false",
    "message": "Order is Cancelled.Kindly refresh your OrderBook",
    "errorcode": "RS-00093",
    "data": null
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** Invalid product error
    

```
{
    "status": "false",
    "message": "Invalid product. valid product types allowed are DELIVERY, INTRADAY and CARRYFORWARD.",
    "errorcode": "400",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Cancel All

This endpoint allows users to cancel all the orders at once.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:** A token-based authentication header. The format is token jwtToken.
    
- **X-PrivateKey:** api_key
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_4_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_4_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_4_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_4_4)

```
curl --location --request POST 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/orders/cancelall' \
--header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
--header 'Authorization: {{vault:bearer-token}}' \
--header 'X-PrivateKey: INnHxHlHDwDWPmXMou00TA@@'

 ```

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

- **Success (HTTP Status 200):** On successful order deletion, the server returns a JSON object containing the order ID and status.
    

```
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": {
        "order_id": "1161241001100"
    }
}

 ```

- **Failure (HTTP Status 200):** If orderid does not exist then server will return below json reponse.
    

```
{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Order Does not Exsist.Need to refresh orderbook / relogin in application ",
    "error_type": "InputException",
    "data": null
}

 ```

\- **Failure (HTTP Status 400):** If the API Key is Invalid or expired.

```
{
    "status": "false",
    "message": "API is suspended/expired for use. Please check your API subscription and try again.",
    "errorcode": "IA403",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Order Book

This endpoint allows users to retrieve a list of their trading orders. Users can view all their existing orders.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version :** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization :** A token-based authentication header. The format is token jwtToken.
    
- **X-PrivateKey :** api_key
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_5_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_5_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_5_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_5_4)

```
curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/orders' \
    --header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
    --header 'X-PrivateKey: api_key' \
    --header 'Authorization: {{vault:bearer-token}}'

 ```

**Request Body -** This endpoint does not require a request body or additional parameters in the query string for the retrieval of orders.

**Response Structure -**

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

---

### Trade History

While an orders is sent as single entry but, it may get executed in arbitrary chunks at the exchange level. This endpoint returns a list of all trades generated upon the execution of orders for that day.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:** A token-based authentication header. The format is token jwtToken.
    
- **X-PrivateKey:** api_key
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_6_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_6_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_6_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_6_4)

```
curl --location --request GET 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/trades' \
--header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
--header 'Authorization: {{vault:bearer-token}}' \
--header 'X-PrivateKey: api_key' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data '{
    "fromdate": "2024-01-06",
    "todate" : "2025-01-07"
}'

 ```

**Request Body -** The body of the request must be URL-encoded and include the following parameters:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| fromdate | string | 2024-01-06 |
| todate | string | 2025-01-07 |

The response of the request will be based on authentication outcome.

    "errorcode": "IA403",
    "data": null
}

 ```

---

### Individual Order Details

This endpoint allows users to retrieve the status of individual order using the order id.

**Request Headers -**

- **X-Mirae-Version:** Specifies the version of the API being used. In this case, it is set to 1.
    
- **Authorization:** A token-based authentication header. The format is token jwtToken.
    
- **X-PrivateKey:** api_key
    

[cURL](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_7_1)[Node.js](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_7_2)[Python](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_7_3)[Java](https://tradingapi.mstock.com/docs/v1/typeB/Orders/#__tabbed_7_4)

```
curl --location --request GET 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/order/details' \
--header 'X-Mirae-Version: 1' \
--header 'Authorization: {{vault:bearer-token}}' \
--header 'X-PrivateKey: api_key' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data '{
    "order_no": "1181250130105",

}'

curl --location 'https://api.mstock.trade/openapi/typeb/margins/orders' \
